Posts.Content: On 10/8/2007 tam92407 wrote: Prior to my bilateral mast next week, I have to have blue dye injected for the sentinel node biopsy.  I have heard this dye is very painful.  Anyone know for sure?   I had the dye injection on 10/9 and my lumpectomy was on 10/10.  I ask the administering tech if the procedure would be painful or uncomfortable.  She was very honest and made sure I understood as she repeated to me 3 times.....it is going to sting and burn.  I asked if I would be able to resume my house cleaning after I leave from the procedure, she said yes, but again the procedure of the injection will sting and burn.  I was injected 4 times around the nipple and each time she inserted the needle it did 'sting' and then the flow of the dye quickly followed and it did 'burn'.  The burning sensation felt like someone had a lighter lit against me.  After the first prick, I found something in the procedure room to focus on and each injection thereafter I just clinched my bottom lip between my teeth and just said 'fire' each time the dye flowed.  If you don't think this will help you by focusing on something in the room and bracing yourself for each injection, take a small stuff animal with you to squeeze.  After the dye procedure, I experienced no tingling, pain, etc.  Go luck!!!
Posts.Title: Blue Dye
